p: CoVs belong to the Nidovirales order— Coronaviridae family—and received their names from the unique “crown-like” spikes that are visible on the outer membrane of the virions. Coronaviruses are large enveloped, single-stranded positive-sense RNA viruses that are broken down into four classes: Alpha, Beta, Gamma, and Deltacoronavirus. Coronaviruses are the largest RNA viruses known with a genome ranging between 27 and 32 kb. Like all the Nidovirales members, Coronaviruses have a highly conserved genomic organization, unique enzymatic activities, and express non-structural genes by ribosomal frameshifting.
